drug.name: Fleroxacin
drug.description: Fleroxacin is a broad-spectrum antimicrobial fluoroquinolone. It strongly inhibits the DNA-supercoiling activity of DNA gyrase. Fleroxacin is not an inhibitor of CYP1A2.[A39048]

article.citation: Fuhr U, Anders EM, Mahr G, Sorgel F, Staib AH: Inhibitory potency of quinolone antibacterial agents against cytochrome P450IA2 activity in vivo and in vitro. Antimicrob Agents Chemother. 1992 May;36(5):942-8.

drug.indication: Fleroxacin is a broad-spectrum antimicrobial fluoroquinolone.
drug.pharmacodynamics: Fleroxacin is a broad-spectrum antimicrobial fluoroquinolone. It strongly inhibits the DNA-supercoiling activity of DNA gyrase.
drug.mechanism-of-action: The inhibition of DNA gyrase and DNA topoisomerase 2 leads ultimately to cell death as these enzymes are required for bacterial DNA replication, transcription, repair, strand supercoiling repair, and recombination.
drug.absorption: Rapidly and well absorbed from the gastrointestinal tract after oral administration.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as quinoline carboxylic acids. These are quinolines in which the quinoline ring system is substituted by a carboxyl group at one or more positions.

food-interactions.food-interaction: Avoid milk, calcium containing dairy products, iron, magnesium, zinc, antacids, or aluminum salts 2 hours before or 6 hours after using antacids while on this medication.
Take with a full glass of water

article.citation: Chen X, Ji ZL, Chen YZ: TTD: Therapeutic Target Database. Nucleic Acids Res. 2002 Jan 1;30(1):412-5.

Hussy P, Maass G, Tummler B, Grosse F, Schomburg U: Effect of 4-quinolones and novobiocin on calf thymus DNA polymerase alpha primase complex, topoisomerases I and II, and growth of mammalian lymphoblasts. Antimicrob Agents Chemother. 1986 Jun;29(6):1073-8.

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 2-alpha
polypeptide.specific-function: Control of topological states of DNA by transient breakage and subsequent rejoining of DNA strands. Topoisomerase II makes double-strand breaks. Essential during mitosis and meiosis for proper segregation of daughter chromosomes. May play a role in regulating the period length of ARNTL/BMAL1 transcriptional oscillation (By similarity).

go-classifier.description: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus
DNA unwinding involved in DNA replication
positive regulation of single stranded viral RNA replication via double stranded DNA intermediate
positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter
positive regulation of viral genome replication

target.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
target.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

article.citation: Naber KG: Fleroxacin overview. Chemotherapy. 1996 Mar;42 Suppl 1:1-9.

Asahina Y, Iwase K, Iinuma F, Hosaka M, Ishizaki T: Synthesis and antibacterial activity of 1-(2-fluorovinyl)-7-substituted-4-quinolone-3-carboxylic acid derivatives, conformationally restricted analogues of fleroxacin. J Med Chem. 2005 May 5;48(9):3194-202.

polypeptide.name: DNA gyrase subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: DNA gyrase negatively supercoils closed circular double-stranded DNA in an ATP-dependent manner and also catalyzes the interconversion of other topological isomers of double-stranded DNA rings, including catenanes and knotted rings.
polypeptide.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

target.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
target.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)

article.citation: Drlica K, Zhao X: DNA gyrase, topoisomerase IV, and the 4-quinolones. Microbiol Mol Biol Rev. 1997 Sep;61(3):377-92.

Lee JK, Lee YS, Park YK, Kim BS: Mutations in the gyrA and parC genes in ciprofloxacin-resistant clinical isolates of Acinetobacter baumannii in Korea. Microbiol Immunol. 2005;49(7):647-53.

Leavis HL, Willems RJ, Top J, Bonten MJ: High-level ciprofloxacin resistance from point mutations in gyrA and parC confined to global hospital-adapted clonal lineage CC17 of Enterococcus faecium. J Clin Microbiol. 2006 Mar;44(3):1059-64.

polypeptide.name: DNA topoisomerase 4 subunit A
polypeptide.specific-function: Topoisomerase IV is essential for chromosome segregation. It relaxes supercoiled DNA. Performs the decatenation events required during the replication of a circular DNA molecule.
polypeptide.organism: Haemophilus influenzae (strain ATCC 51907 / DSM 11121 / KW20 / Rd)
